title: SB 1.19.14-15 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 20-05-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: A devotee is fully surrendered to Krishna, and his life is in Krishna's hands. So he considers anything that happens, good or bad in his life, materially good or bad, to be the mercy of the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami explains Pariksit Maharaj's humble acceptance of the brahmana's curse as the Lord's mercy, highlighting the devotee's surrender and detachment from material attachments.

segments.key_quote: Such direct action is taken by the Lord in the case of a special devotee.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Srila Prabhupada's explanation of Pariksit Maharaj's situation, emphasizing that the Lord directly intervenes in the lives of special devotees to detach them from material life, using Prabhupada's own life as an example.

segments.key_quote: The Lord resides with his devotees and therefore, the presence of the great saintly persons indicated the presence of the Lord.
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami explains that Pariksit Maharaj understood the Lord's favor through the presence of great saintly persons, emphasizing that their presence signifies the Lord's presence and facilitates spiritual advancement, before beginning to explain the 15th verse.

segments.key_quote: So this is the right attitude for a perfect devotee who is properly prepared to go back to Godhead.
segments.summary: The speaker explains Pariksit Maharaj's prayer for complete surrender to the brahmanas and Mother Ganga, highlighting his desire for purification and immersion in the glories of Lord Vishnu even at the moment of death.

segments.key_quote: This freedom from fear of death is a very very important point.
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami concludes by emphasizing the importance of freedom from the fear of death, which is achieved through complete surrender to the Lord and the creation of a spiritual atmosphere in the association of devotees.
